reviews.text: This B&B is perfect for the night before a flight. It's a family run place, very friendly and helpful. My room was small but enough room for me for one night. It was very clean and everything you could want is ready there in the room (tea and coffee making facilities, towels, fan, tv). The food was very good (i had delicious homemade soup for dinner and full english breakfast before my flight). The prices were brilliant and included airport transfers. I would 100% stay here again and recommend it to everyone!
reviews.title: perfect, friendly and minutes from gatwick airport

reviews.text: Was very impressed with this hotel. Stayed for 1 night as we were flying early from Gatwick in the morning, the room was spacious, clean, furniture and bathroom were modern. Staff were very friendly, helped with arranging transfers and gave us ideas of local things to do to amuse our 3 year old. Although the next day we flew to Menorca and into the holiday from hell, the first part of our holiday (1 night!) spent at this hotel was great and we have agreed that if we ever have to catch an early morning flight from Gatwick, we will stay in this hotel again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, will def stay again

reviews.text: I just returned from spending 5 nights in this hotel with a group of 28 students aged 10 and 11. Many of these students are used to 5* hotels so I wasn't sure what they would think, but I must say, all of my students LOVED this hotel (I've had parents tell me that their children went on and on about the cosiness of it and the friendliness of the staff when we arrived back after our trip).
reviews.title: Amazing hospitality for a school group!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I started planning our trip months in advance and Maria was always there to answer my many (and I do mean many) questions about the hotel, transportation into London, etc, even agreeing to make packed lunches for us each day. Maria and her staff could not have been more helpful and friendly to us all during the duration of our stay!
reviews.title: Friendly staff, convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was amazing and extremely filling and lasted us for hours which certainly helped with such a packed itinerary in London each day. It was great to be able to allow the kids to just head down to breakfast on their own when they woke up each day without having to worry about whether they'd be well fed or taken care of... this was certainly a given!
reviews.title: Ticked all the boxes for us!

reviews.text: Everything was as expected. Beds high quality, plenty of pillows etc. Pick up from station, and bus to Gatwick very smooth. All staff welcoming. Nice little bar area too.
reviews.title: A professionally run and welcoming family hotel.

reviews.text: We arrived after a nightmare drive down from Buckinghamshire through deep snow - never had we been so glad to see a hotel. In the car park a space for our car had already been cleared of snow, which was greatly appreciated. The owners (Chris & Maria) could not have been more friendly or welcoming and gave a really personal and considerate service. We had a comfortable family room with good en-suite - clean and well equipped. Accommodation was excellent value for money, possibly the best we've experienced. Great atmosphere in the bar, a bit like being in your local pub as everyone was chatting to each other. I wasn't surprised to learn that many guests had been coming there for years - we'd do the same! Hotel was fully booked but all service (including restaurant and bar) was quick and efficient. We regretted the fact that we'd pre-booked car parking in the long stay at Gatwick as the hotel parking was a much better deal value - we'll know for next time. (And there will definitely be a next time!)
reviews.title: A haven of warmth in the storm

reviews.text: Hi guys, believe me or not but seriously I’d been checking in on this hotel since Aug 2008 and my other colleague from across UK and US. Like others, I do work 4 on 4 off at home equal rotational basis. This was an awful hotel, worth the price you pay for it. The location is great, and the rates are low. The staff is generally helpful and nice. I always got the Single En Suite Room which includes breakfast includes English breakfast or continental for early departures and Airport Transfers Collection from Gatwick Airport. The room I mentioned which was ideal as I was staying there all by myself but they have got a family room for those who travel with the loveone. The beds are clean and comfortable. Bathroom is so clean. The food is great especially my favorite gammon steak. The continental breakfast is a 5 star at most. I am always happy on every return to this hotel, it’s absolutely recommended.
reviews.title: Highly Recommended

reviews.text: this hotel ticks all the boxes,have stayed twice at this hotel and found the owner/staff to be very accomadating add to this the reasonably priced weeks parking and free transfer to and from the airport comfortable rooms and real food menu it all adds up to to a real gem of a find if like me you travel a lot and want a homely ,convenient, reasonably priced start to a holiday . m.griffin
reviews.title: good way to start you holiday

reviews.text: We always stay here when we travel from gatwick airport. The staff are always friendly and the food is great...love the full english in the morning ! The rooms are good, not huge, but we only need to sleep there. The rates for leaving your car there whilst abroad are very good and they pick you up free of charge from gatwick or local stations. We have stayed on many occassions and have recomended it to many friends and family.
reviews.title: WE ALWAYS STAY HERE WHEN FLYING FROM GATWICK

reviews.text: Due to my flight connection I had to spend one night in London and since my flight the next day was from Gatwick Airport I booked a room approximatley 1 month early at The Corner House Hotel. I provided them with my credit card details and they confirmed the reservation.
reviews.title: Reservation cancelled

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, upon arrival at Gatwick with the airport shuttle bus from Heathrow I contacted Airport Information at Gatwick who called the Corner House Hotel just to be told that they had given my room to somebody else. This was at the time of heavy snow and demand for rooms were therefore high, I was left in the cold even though I had my reservation confirmed and I had even informed them of my late arrival.
reviews.title: Average stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at The Corner House Hotel on previous occasions and they should therefore know that my credit card is good.
reviews.title: Brilliant location for airport , friendly and helpful staff. Will definitely return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night following a holiday from Las Vegas. Id emailed the hotel before i booked to explain that i landed at 10.30am and would it be OK to check in as soon as i arrived due to jet lag and not wanting to be kept hanging about. I was told it wouldnt be a problem them getting a room ready for that time. I booked it and received confirmation, it didnt say that the hotel would only take a deposit as i was under the impression that the full cost would be taken at booking. Not a problem but it would be nice if they made it clear a deposit is taken and the rest paid when you check out. It also doesnt really say where your supposed to go to get the transport when your at Gatwick in the hotels confirmation, all it says it go to ground level and turn left!!! I had to call them up and was told to go to a certain bus stand number which is where the freephone is to call the hotel. It would be better if they made these directions a bit more clear.
reviews.title: Comfortable airport hotel, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transport was fine to the hotel. When i arrived it was like i was walking into someones house, not a bad thing but unusual. Was greeted and checked in and the room wasnt ready. Now i only had to wait about 10-15 mins but what was the point in me emailing them, them replying saying yes we can get a room ready when i end up waiting after all. All i wanted to do was go to bed after a 10 hour flight. Got to the room which was a twin and it was clean and basic. Didnt get hardly any sleep at all as the bed was very lumpy and the quilt and sheets didnt fit very well. Also the cleaner was hoovering the room directly above our room. Now i know the hotel has to clean the rooms but wouldnt it have been a good idea to give me a upstairs room seen as id already explained i was coming off a 10 hour flight and just wanted to sleep!!!
reviews.title: Excellent airport hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed one night here before early flight from Gatwick, had dinner which was lovely but I was disappointed with breakfast. As up early we were able to help ourselves to rolls, fruit etc but no toaster available for guests to use. Room ok but en suite was tiny and I think anyone on the large side would have a bit of struggle to get in and out of it. All nice and clean but I would choose somewhere else next time. Also staff work between bar and reception so always a queue at the bar until you are spotted.
reviews.title: Could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: perfect all round stay; good service at bar, good transport early morning to airport.Room has all facilities and very very clean!! Would use again!!
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here overnight in November. The check in process was good, with friendly staff. The bedroom was of a good size and well appointed. The road noise was intrusive into the early hours. The bar area was nice but poorly stocked. Breakfast was very good. We used the car parking facility for one week, which was well priced. I was very upset when we got back to the car to find it parked in such a way that I had to tread on wet grass to clear the windows and screen, and as I moved around the vehicle it became obvious that it had been moved/parked under a fern tree for the duration. It was plastered in bits that took around ten minutes to clean off. Not a nice welcome back.
reviews.title: Great value shame about the noise.
Not recommended, customer service very low on priortities
reviews.text: With an arduous 12 hour return journey from holiday and an 11.00pm landing, we wanted a hassle-free bit of comfort before a long drive home. We booked this hotel because it had a free courtesy bus until 12midnight. The flight was 20 mins late but I phoned the hotel at 11.50pm to confirm we had one bag and just waiting a second (which arrived as I finished the call). A very negative staff member told me it was unlikely we would be free by 12 and that their bus was already at North Terminal (we were at South) collecting clients. We literally ran with our bags to the courtesy bus stop and I called again just before 12 to be curtly told we were too late, the bus had returned to the hotel (knowing we were at the airport) and would not turn out again. We then had the hassle of finding a taxi, but still arrived at the hotel at 8 minutes past 12, and had to pay £9 fare. On top of that we got a twin room having booked double, the room was very, very 'tired' with stained carpet and duvet covers, smelt musty and the milk was curdled. At reception I explained about the double/twin and got not response!! No questions around 'had we enjoyed our stay etc'. Customer service - NIL.

It was almost midnight when I called from Gatwick airport and they came out and picked us up. Transport to and from the airport was great. The staff was friendly and breakfast was great. The room itself was very clean but was very warm so we opened the window and our room soon became very noisy from the road noise so it was tough to sleep without ear plugs. In the road facing room it would have been nice to have air conditioning. Also would have been nice to have an alarm clock and blow dryer in the room especially for the price paid.
reviews.title: Good and bad
